SEARCH
Module se1.bestellsystem
Package application

Class Application_E12

Object
Application_E12
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runtime.Runnable
public class Application_E12 extends Object implements Runtime.Runnable
Driver class for the d34-ordertable assignment. Class creates Customer, Article and Order objects and prints tables of objects.
Class implements the Runtime.Runnable interface.
Version:
"E12-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT"
Author:
"sgraupner"

    Application_E12()
    Default constructor fills maps 'customers' and 'articles'.

    • findCustomerBySpec

      public Optional<Customer> findCustomerBySpec(String customerSpec)
      Find Customer object in customers map by a specification, which is the first match by id or in the lastName or in the firstName attribute (in that order).
      Parameters:
      customerSpec - specification of a customer by id or by name
      Returns:
      Customer object or empty Optional

    • findArticleBySpec

      public Optional<Article> findArticleBySpec(String articleSpec)
      Find Article object in articles map by a specification, which is the first match by id or in the description attribute (in that order).
      Parameters:
      articleSpec - specification of an article by id or by description
      Returns:
      Article object or empty Optional

    • printOrders

      public StringBuilder printOrders(Collection<Order> orders)
      Print objects of class Order as table row into a StringBuilder.
      Parameters:
      orders - orders to print as row into table
      Returns:
      StringBuilder with orders rendered in table format
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - with null arguments

    • calculateIncludedVAT

      public long calculateIncludedVAT(long grossValue, double taxRate)
      Calculate a tax included in a gross ("brutto") value based on a given tax rate. Applies to VAT taxes called "Mehrwertsteuer" (MwSt.) in Germany.
      Parameters:
      grossValue - value that includes the tax
      taxRate - applicable tax rate
      Returns:
      tax included in gross value or 0L if gross value <= 0L

    • calculateOrderItemValue

      public long calculateOrderItemValue(Order.OrderItem item, Pricing pricing)
      Calculate the value of an Order.OrderItem as: article.unitPrice * number of units ordered.
      Parameters:
      item - to calculate value for
      pricing - Pricing to find article unitPrice
      Returns:
      value of ordered item
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - with null arguments

    • calculateOrderItemVAT

      public long calculateOrderItemVAT(Order.OrderItem item, Pricing pricing)
      Calculate the VAT included in an order item price uding method: calculateVAT(long grossValue, double taxRate).
      Parameters:
      item - to calculate VAT for
      pricing - Pricing to find VAT tax rate applicable to article
      Returns:
      VAT for ordered item
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - with null arguments

    • calculateOrderValue

      public long calculateOrderValue(Order order)
      Calculate the total value of an order from the value of each ordered item, calculated with: calculateOrderItemValue(item).
      Parameters:
      order - to calculate value for
      Returns:
      total value of order
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - with null argument

    • calculateOrderVAT

      public long calculateOrderVAT(Order order)
      Calculate the total VAT of an order from compounded VAT of order items calculated with: calculateOrderItemVAT(item).
      Parameters:
      order - to calculate VAT tax for
      Returns:
      VAT calculated for order
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - with null argument

    • fmtPrice

      public String fmtPrice(long price, Pricing.Currency currency, int... style)
      Format long value to price according to a format (0 is default): 
       Example: long value: 499
 style: 0: "4.99"
        1: "4.99 EUR"     3: "4.99 €"
        2: "4.99EUR"      4: "4.99€"
      Parameters:
      price - long value as price
      currency - Pricing.Currency to obtain currency three-letter code or Unicode
      style - price formatting style
      Returns:
      price formatted according to selcted style

    • fmtDecimal

      public String fmtDecimal(long value, int decimalDigits, String... unit)
      Format long value to a decimal String with specified digit formatting: 
            {      "%,d", 1L },     // no decimal digits:  16,000Y
      { "%,d.%01d", 10L },
      { "%,d.%02d", 100L },   // double-digit price: 169.99E
      { "%,d.%03d", 1000L },  // triple-digit unit:  16.999-
      Parameters:
      value - value to format to String in decimal format
      decimalDigits - number of digits
      unit - appended unit as String
      Returns:
      decimal value formatted according to specified digit formatting
